item.title: Strengthening calendar security through enhanced remediation
item.description: In today’s evolving threat landscape, phishing attacks are becoming increasingly sophisticated, often leveraging meeting invites to bypass traditional defenses. While Security Operations (SOC) teams rely on Microsoft Defender’s remediation actions to remove malicious emails, a hidden risk persists: calendar entries created by Outlook during email delivery. These entries can remain active even after the email is deleted, leaving users exposed to harmful content. This update addresses that gap.
